text_to_embed: Merge Sort is a divide and conquer algorithm. It divides the array into two halves, and then merges the two sorted halves. Time complexity is O(n log n).
An array is a collection of items stored at contiguous memory locations. It makes it easier to calculate the position of each element.
Binary Search is a searching algorithm used in a sorted array by repeatedly dividing the search interval in half.
A linked list is a linear data structure where elements are not stored at contiguous locations. Elements are linked using pointers.
A stack is a linear data structure that follows the Last In First Out (LIFO) principle. It supports two main operations: push and pop.
A queue is a linear data structure that follows the First In First Out (FIFO) principle. It supports two main operations: enqueue and dequeue.
A binary tree is a tree data structure in which each node has at most two children, referred to as the left child and the right child.
A hash table is a data structure that implements an associative array abstract data type, a structure that can map keys to values.
Dynamic programming is a method for solving complex problems by breaking them down into simpler subproblems, storing the results of subproblems to avoid redundant work.
A graph is a data structure that consists of a set of nodes (vertices) and a set of edges that connect pairs of nodes.
